From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


Upcoming film by Shariq Qureshi


EmergencyTeaser posterDirected byKangana RanautScreenplay byRitesh ShahStory byKangana RanautProduced byKangana RanautRenu PittiStarring
Kangana Ranaut
Anupam Kher
Shreyas Talpade
Mahima Chaudhry
Milind Soman
CinematographyTetsuo NagataEdited byRameshwar S. BhagatMusic byG. V. Prakash KumarProductioncompaniesManikarnika FilmsEaseMyTripDistributed byZee StudiosRelease date
14 June 2024 (2024-06-14)
CountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Emergency is an upcoming Indian Hindi-language biographical historical drama film directed and produced by Kangana Ranaut, from a screenplay by Ritesh Shah and story by Ranaut.[1] Based on the Indian Emergency, it stars Ranaut as former Prime Minister of India, Indira Gandhi.[2][3] The film also features Anupam Kher, Shreyas Talpade, Mahima Chaudhry and Milind Soman in pivotal roles.
Principal photography commenced in July 2022 and ended in January 2023.[4] It marks the posthumous film of Satish Kaushik following his death on 9 March 2023. The film was scheduled for a theatrical release on November 24, 2023, but it was postponed.[5]


Cast[edit]
Kangana Ranaut as Prime Minister Indira Gandhi[6]
Anupam Kher as Jayaprakash Narayan[7]
Shreyas Talpade as Atal Bihari Vajpayee[8]
Ashok Chhabra as Morarji Desai
Mahima Chaudhry as Pupul Jayakar, Indira Gandhi's close confidante[9]
Milind Soman as Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw[10]
Vishak Nair as Sanjay Gandhi[11]
Satish Kaushik as Jagjivan Ram[12]
Larry Newyorker  as Lieutenant General
Richard Bhakti Klein as Henry Kissinger
Scott Alexander Young as Richard Nixon 
Christophe Guybet  as Georges Pompidou
Adhir Bhat  as Feroze Gandhi
Mannveer Choudharry as Doordarshan Reporter
Zeba Hussain as Kamala Nehru
Cyrille Mansuy as Chef Napoleon
Release[edit]
The film is postponed for a theatrical release on 14 June 2024.[13][14]
